basic.floral_language:
Buxus sempervirens
Floriography: tough, pretty, vigorous
Buxus sempervirens is a shrub or small tree with leathery and glossy oval leaves. Often planted as ornamental trees in the yard, street, parks. Can also be hedges.
Buxus sempervirens likes light, tolerates half shade. When conditions are right, blooms in March to April sometimes with yellow flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in March-April, yellow flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like light, and slight shade tolerance
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may rub leaves with water when dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
